intro: Eriospermum cooperi var. natalense, commonly known as Natal eriospermum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. This species is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance in landscaping.
